physical_examinations.vital_signs: ICP: 38 mm Hg (initial), 29 mm Hg (4 months later), normal after bariatric surgery
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Optic nerve edema observed during fundoscopy, progressive visual acuity loss, incapacitating headaches.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: High ICP was measured (38 mm Hg, then 29 mm Hg). Following gastric bypass surgery, ICP returned to normal levels; however, headaches worsened post-surgery.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual field campimetry showed minimal improvement post-surgery, with ongoing complaints of headaches.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Headaches progressed and were characterized by episodes of sonophobia and photophobia.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Both ICP sensors showed correlation and reliability during long-term monitoring.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: ICP measurements showed a difference of 3â€“4 mm Hg between sensors, with no associated changes in headaches noted.
